Originally issued to the Czech army in 1958, the VZ58 is still in use by both the Czech and Slovak armies, their police and customs agents. Though similar to the other rifles of this style in appearance, the VZ58 uses a completely different bolt and fire control system. Even with a machined receiver, the VZ2008 is lighter than most similarly styled firearms with a sheet metal receiver. title: For Sale:  Sporterized Swiss K1911 Chambered in .308
postcontent:
Selling a rifle I've had for a while in order to put money into other projects.

It's a straight pull Swiss k1911 similar to the K31 in design, but slightly older.  The rifle was most likely sporterized by Golden State Firearms in the 1960's and rechambered to .308 at the same time.  Makes a good shooter or cheap hunting rifle, it's drilled and tapped for a scope mount that can be found online for these rifles.  

I had it checked out by TJ's Gunsmithing in Aurora after I bought it to be sure that this older rifle was still in good condition, and they said it's good to go.  

I bought a Remington 700 to hunt with, and just don't shoot this enough to justify keeping it around.  

Price is firm, not interested in trades.  Because this rifle qualifies as a Curio & Relic (anything over 50 years old does), it does not require a Colorado background check to transfer.  Cash and Carry to the first person to come pick it up.  Must be over 18 and able to meet at or near my place, can't deliver.  

If interested shoot me an email with a time and date that you would like to stop by to see, as well as a phone number so that I can call you back and confirm.  

If the add is still up, I still have the rifle.  Emails asking if it is still available will be ignored.

title: For Sale:  2005 ONE OF A KIND HUMMER H2 SUT STRETCH LIMO TACTICAL PERSONNEL (family) CARRIER
location: Goldsboro, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
One unique machine. About 2 foot longer than a Suburban. This 2005 Hummer is the SUT with the pick up style back with mid gate similar to an Avalanche. It was stretched about 60 inches giving it a third row of seating along the side and a bar with refrigerator and storage on the other. This vehicle is the only Corporate length Hummer stretch SUT I have ever seen or can even find on google image search. The 4x4 system works perfectly and unlike most of the monster stretch hummer sit has not been disconnected. It has a full towing setup with electronic trailer braking controls. 

It does not have electric dividers as this was designed to be a personal family transport vehicle. It would make an awesome company advertising truck or a killer rig for a boat hauler or landscape crew vehicle. Or like a Soccer Mom / Dad car. I have used this vehicle and never had anything as much fun to drive. It handles easy, looks remarkable, mad parks almost as easy as a standard Suburban would. 

This vehicle has been built to last with only the finest in stamped body panels unlike some fiberglass or sheet metal poor quality limo extension panels. Hummer interior designed to seat 7/8 like the not SUT HUMMER DOES EXCEPT HAS MIDGATE DROP BACK. 

Check eBay and online and see stretch bummers with 100000 miles are selling from 45/70k and this one is an approx 70k miles truck and I am asking $39,900 for it. I have other cars listed for sale to try and make room for some incoming vehicles. If other cars sell first I will keep this one for myself. VERY COLLECTIBLE DUE TO RARETY AND bummers no longer made. 
PLEASE NOTE I AM NOT A DEALER. I AM A COLLECTOR. I DO NOT BUY TO RESELL. I BUY BECAUSE I WANT IT AND OCCASIONALLY I RUN OUT OF STORAGE ROOM AND HAVE TO PART WITH A FEW NEW SPACES. NOBODY BETTER TO BUY FROM THAN SOMEONE WHO LOVED IT ENOUGH TO BUY IT FOR THEMSELVES.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1893 Mauser and bayonet
postcontent:
Model 1893 Mauser, made in Berlin by Ludwig Loewe in 1894 for Turkish contract.  Converted from 7.65x53 to 7.92x57 (8 mm mauser) in 1935 in Ankara.  This conversion required cutting a notch in the receiver for the longer cartridge and cutting a notch on the side for use of stripper clips.  Most markings were scrubbed during the conversion but this one retains the Turkish script and original date of manufacture 1312 on the Islam calendar or 1894 by ours.  I also am including the bayonet with the matching Turkish script and shipping for $250 or best offer.  This is an antique so no FFL transfer is required.  For local pick up I will include 40 rounds of Turkish surplus ammo on stripper clips in a bandolier.
Text two six nine 267 4 zero 75

title: For Sale:  Springfield M1A
postcontent:
This has been my favorite rifle for a long time, but due to a shoulder separation (collarbone isn't connected to my shoulder anymore) it's time for it to move on. It has a TRW barrel and bolt and many other GI parts.  The serial number puts it's DOB somewhere around 2001, so they still had reasonable stockpiles of GI parts back then.  The stock and handguard are USGI fiberglass that have been stripped, primed, and given a low key Krylon Camo paint job.  It's held up well, but it's not pristine anymore. It doesn't really look "camo," but it disappears in the woods. 

The rifle has had around 4500 rounds through it, but never very fast.  Most of them were shot at a piece of steel armor plate at 250 yards. Lots of good shooting left in this barrel.  At this price, the rifle will come with 5 20 round mags and enough SA surplus ammo to fill them.  

Additional mags and ammo available to the buyer.  Also have some fair to poor wood stocks and some spare parts available separately.


 I'd rather not drive too far on this.  I need cash, so not looking for any close trades at this time.   Miiiiight be willing to take a decent .22 pistol or a Smith SD9VE plus cash.  Thanks for looking.

postcontent:
The Sightmark 5x Tactical Magnifier with the slide to side mount is designed for use in conjunction with holographic, collimated reflex, and other compatible weapons sights, giving the shooter the benefit of a reflex sight and scope in one combination. The magnifier increases the magnification of the accompanying sight for greater sighting range and improves target recognition, especially at medium to long range distances. The Sightmark 5x Tactical Magnifier can assist in quick target acquisition up to 350 yards and accurate target shooting at 150 yards The Sightmark Tactical Magnifier also features extended eye relief for comfort, a wide field of view for superior target acquisition and high quality multicoated optics for improved visibility and clarity. The Sightmark 5x Tactical Magnifier can be mounted on most picatinny and weaver mounts and is designed to work with EOTech, Aimpoint, Trijicon and other brands. A lightweight, waterproof, fog proof and shatter-proof frame provides durability in all elements.

Objective: 29mm

title: For Sale:  M+M Company M10-762 AK-47 pattern rifle - All black, hogue grip, razor brake, quadrail handguard, more... MUST SEE!
location: Capitola / Santa Cruz, CA, San Francisco, California
postcontent:
Well, the Mrs. and I have decided to put a little more money into our RV solar project than originally anticipated so unfortunately I have to sell one of my more valuable toys.  We picked up a couple of AK pattern rifles last year and with two babies, full time school and work, we haven't even had time to go shoot them.  The more expensive of the two was the M+M Company M10-762, an awesome rifle of which I own another from the same company and which I've shot quite a bit, and never once had a failure.  They are very well built rifles and accurized from the factory, out of the box I was hitting 6" steel plates at 100yards in the standing shooter position with no problem.  Like I said we haven't taken either of the two new rifles we bought from last year before the CA law change (reason for purchase) out shooting yet, SO THIS RIFLE IS BRAND NEW CONDITION, NEVER FIRED!!! :)   I guess it's not so hard to buy rifles in CA now though, rifles are just treated like handguns now, so you have the whole safety cert to pay for at your dealer (of course that is if you don't have one already).  The only probs we still have out here in CA are the availability of rifles in the legal CA pattern.  This AK has the mag-release lock as required here in CA, and was shipped to Santa Cruz Armory in Ben Lomond, CA just last year where we purchased it.  So, you're good to go.  The lock is easily removed with a couple of allen-wrenches if you were to ever move out of state, and of course the rifle accepts regular 30rnd AK mags.

Here's a couple of links with info on the rifle.  One to the company website and and another to a rather lengthy third party review:

http://mm-industries.com/m10-specs/

http://www.thetruthaboutguns.com/2013/10/joe-grine/gun-review-mm-m10-762-rifle/

We're asking $650, a total steal for this rifle.  The rifle will come with one Tapco 10/30 mag (is a CA legal 10rnd mag that is the size of a 30rnd'r as is blocked off inside).

Any questions feel free to email or call.  Thanks!

title: For Sale:  Henry .22 Magnum Lever Action Rifle
postcontent:
Fine condition, couple years old, Henry .22 Magnum Lever Action Rifle.
This rifle is truly a blast; you can shoot it all day and it just stays fun to shoot from dawn to dusk. The 22 mag has plenty of zip to shoot targets at considerable distance, and you can take any small game with it. Prairie Dogs are a hoot to go after, and the lever action enables you to get several shots off before the dogs know you're shooting. You can even take a deer with this rifle, you just need good shot placement, which the Henry gives you without any problem probably out to 100 yards max. 
You can also learn to speed shoot this rifle; by working the lever and trigger together, you can shoot this rifle almost as fast as an AR-15. It takes considerable practice to get the skill, but once you have it you have something to show off that will delight and surprise others.
This Henry has seen only very light use, and is in excellent condition. It has one little scrape on the top of the receiver that is easily fixed with a little bluing; otherwise, it's perfect.
They go for $500 new, and about $460 discounted.
I'm selling this one for $400 firm. If you want it, please text me on my cell at REDACTED. Please, no calls unless you are darned sure you're coming my way to pay cash and you don't have text. No offers; the price is firm: come with $400 cash or don't contact me.
I really hate to sell it, but I need cash for my new business.

title: For Sale:  SKS
postcontent:
I cannot speak to its condition because I have never shot the rifle. It is a Jianshe. Happy to send more pics if you would like. If you need anything else, please let me know. 

Here is some info in the listing used by the party from whom I had purchased the rifle:

Years of production are 1956, 1958, or 1959, we will honor requests as best possible. Here is an eminently serviceable specimen of the Chinese type 56 infantry rifle chambered in 7.62x39 caliber, that we call the SKS. Manufacturer was Jianshe Arsenal in the People’s Republic of China, on Russian milling equipment and under Russian supervision. From its number 2 prefix onto a 400000 range serial number, it was manufactured in 1958, when the ARVN Army mobilized its commando training school at Nha Trang. Importer is Century Arms International, so marked on the right side of the barrel. Type, of course, is gas operated semi-automatic rifle. Construction is milled blue steel barrel, receiver and parts; and Asian Hardwood stock. Barrel is standard 20 inch, calibrated military rear sight and elevation adjustable front sight, with drift capability for windage – on the well hooded front sight. Bayonet is period correct blade type. Surface detractions are moderate to extensive on this specimen. It shows some substantial original bluing, but perhaps majority gun metal gray. Buttstock has extensive scouring and dinging, but no outright cracks. Trigger group, magazine, bolt, cover, and receiver serial numbers are all matching. Stock cartouches match as well, so this rifle is entirely original. We rate this type 56 as Good, 60 percent vicinity by our estimate.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Custom Para 1911
postcontent:
Bottom Line Up Front: This just sits in my safe. What just sits in your safe?

This is Para Ordnance G.I. Expert that was customized to my tastes a few years ago. Do not be fooled by the movie prop appearance. The compensator on the front is fully functional, all the aftermarket hardware is from Wilson combat and the pistol is quite accurate. The compensator (in theory- I've never tested this) Would keep the action locked up a split second longer and allow the gun to run hotter loads without beating up the frame. 

I was speaking to a former gun smith the other day and he liked the trigger, although the set screw does need to be replace. He said that he'd value the pistol around 700-750 bucks. That sounds about right since the G.I. Experts are going for about 650 stock. Now with this I am also including the hard case, three magazines, the guns original hardware, a mag pouch and holster, 50ish rounds of ball point, and possibly RCBS reloading dies as well as 50 rounds of unfired brass (depending on the deal).  


I'm more interested in a trade than cash; I'll list a few things I had interest in:

-Magnum Revolvers 
-Glock 20
-AR-15s - I know this would only be worth a very entry level one
-Kel-Tec Sub 2000 that accepts Glock mags 
-.30-.30 lever gun+....?
-I would conciser a pair of lower dollar guns- like a 20 gauge Mossberg and a Revolver 

The point is, I haven't shot this weapon in over a year. I would like it to go to someone who will use and enjoy it safely. So just shoot me an offer, it worst I'll just say "no thank you".

ID will be required for the safety of all parties involved in a transaction.

I'm selling my beloved PWS as well as a few other weapons that are difficult to part with, but as I shall soon be moving abroad and will not have use for them there, I'd rather someone else get an opportunity to enjoy them. 

The MK 116 is a very nice piston driven system chambered in .223 Wylde and using the PWS proprietary piston design. This rifle has a 16" barrel, a 13.5" PWS keymod rail system, and the rifle weighs less than 7 lbs. As noted in the title, one of the key upgrades is the Geissele Super Dynamic Enhanced two stage trigger with a smooth 2 lb. first stage and then a crisp 1 lb. second stage. In addition to the trigger upgrade, I've added 45 degree rapid transition backup sights, a competition muzzle brake/compensator that significantly reduces muzzle rise and allows the shooter to take full advantage of the trigger for accurate rapid fire and follow-on shooting, and a 1-5x tactical scope and offset mount. 

I'm the original owner of this rifle, which was purchased in November of last year. I've shot the rifle a few times but it has had no abuse and I estimate the number of rounds fired would be no more than 500 rounds. title: For Sale:  AR-15 MI SSK12 Minute Man Rifle
postcontent:
This is a great rifle and includes numerous upgrades leaving essentially no aspect of the rifle that could be further improved upon. One such improvement is a brand new 16" 1:7 twist DRD hammer forged chrome lined barrel that I had installed in place of the original barrel in early June (poor timing on my part but at the time I had no plans to move abroad). In any event, the rifle has been taken to the range twice since installing this new barrel with roughly 100-200 rounds having been fired. I had originally purchased the rifle in October of 2013. A hard case is also included with the purchase of this rifle.

Other upgrades include the Magpul UBR Stock, Magpul Pro Sights, a Fortis compensator/muzzle brake, and a Geissele Super Dynamic Enhanced Flat two-stage trigger with a smooth 2 lb. first stage and a crisp 1.5 lb. second stage (Note that the Geissele trigger is not pictured as it was just installed and the trigger shown in the pictures is a Timney). The rifle originally came with a shorter 13" rail, but I had this replaced with a new MI Gen 2 quad rail when the new barrel was recently installed. In addition to these upgrades that greatly improve the function, accuracy, and aesthetic of the rifle, a Weaver 1-5x tactical scope with offset mount and a Sight Docter mini red-dot sight is also included. Another nice feature is the upgraded BCG which is a Titanium Boron (TiN) Bolt Carrier Group. You can see the gold coloring of this BCG in the photos and in addition to improving the look, this bcg is very tough due to this coating, quite easy to clean and maintain, and functions flawlessly. 

As I'm preparing to move abroad where I will not have any use for my weapons, I'm selling two rifles, including this one, and one 1911 handgun. This rifle had originally sold for just over $1600 when I purchased it last fall and the value of the aforementioned upgrades has been well over $1,000. Any offer below ask will require no optic and a JP trigger.  I'm really not willing to move much on price but will entertain any offer.  Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!
